content.question: The table above supports which of the following statements?

choices.label: In the 1840â€™s the majority of Britons did not live past fifteen years of age.
The British infant mortality rate was lower in 1841 than in 1967.
The average age of Britons at first marriage was lower in 1967 than it was in 1841.
The change in the age composition of the British population between 1841 and 1967 resulted primarily from emigration.
The average age of the British population was higher in 1967 than in 1841.

content.answer: The average age of the British population was higher in 1967 than in 1841.

topic.text: 9.15: Continuity and Change in the 20th and 21st Centuries

skill.text: Skill 5.A: Identify patterns among or connections between historical developments and processes.
